column4: question for the gallery....why would my ubuntu 6.10 alternate ISO have trouble detecting a SATA hard drive?
i'm trying to run ubuntu on a sata but the drive isn't detected...should i be safe and use an IDE drive??
check the bios I would think
pelo: i have the bios in 'compatiblity mode' on and it proceeds in the install but when it gets to the drive, nothing works...
i've even used 'achi' and 'ata_piix' modes...which sata drives are suppose to work with but it still dies on the install at that point
try this,  open up the comp and unplug the ide drive, leaving only the sata,  see if it gets detected and you can proceed with the install
pelo: i have an ide dvd+r drive (pata) and a WD hard drive (sata)
pelo: i need the dvd+rw drive to install linux on it
sorry from what you were saying I thouht you had two drives ? what's the ide one then ?
pelo: the ide one is my dvd+rw, the sata drive is my hard drive
so you are telling me that your hd isn'T being detected for installation ?
pelo: i'm frustrated to the point where i think i'm going to just use an IDE hard drive instead...nothing works but i've heard that linux has bad sata suppose
I have ubuntu isnatlled on a sata drive and I have no problems
in  the live cd goto  menu > system > admin > gparted and check if your sata drive is being recognises
that's what i don't get - i have an ICH7 northbridge but i'm not sure about the controller
pelo: i was using the alternate ISO
this is over my head then
